## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been thinking about creating my own decentralized token or blockchain on Verus, but I've heard it requires extensive programming knowledge. Is that true?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, creating a decentralized token or blockchain on Verus does not require extensive programming knowledge. With Verus, any user with an ID can create their own token currency or even a full-fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing blockchain without needing to program. This is possible because Verus enables users to create their own tokens and blockchains through a user-friendly interface, eliminating the need for programming expertise. So, don't let that hold you back from exploring the possibilities of Verus!

**User:**
That's really good to know! I've also been wondering about Verus DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets. How do they work if they're not integrated into the consensus protocol?

**AI Assistant:**
That's a great question! Verus DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets are, in fact, integrated into the consensus protocol. This integration ensures that all currency conversions using a particular liquidity pool and mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing issues like miner-extracted value (MEV) and front-running. The integration also provides fee-based DeFi incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities. So, you can rest assured that these features are seamlessly integrated into the Verus ecosystem.

**User:**
Okay, that makes sense. One more question: is it true that launching a new blockchain on Verus requires a separate, manual setup of a bridge converter liquidity pool?

**AI Assistant:**
No, that's not correct. With Verus, the launch of a new blockchain is accompanied by the simultaneous launch of a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool as part of defining the new blockchain. This bridge converter currency has the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset-backed or partially asset-backed currencies and is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, running on the new blockchain. So, you don't need to worry about setting up a separate bridge converter liquidity pool; it's all taken care of automatically when you launch your new blockchain on Verus.
Can you explain why creating a decentralized token or blockchain on Verus requires extensive programming knowledge?

Actually, creating a decentralized token or blockchain on Verus does not require extensive programming knowledge. With Verus, any user with an ID can create their own token currency or even a full-fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing blockchain without needing to program. This is possible because Verus enables users to create their own tokens and blockchains through a user-friendly interface, eliminating the need for programming expertise.

ed on non-Verus systems.
## Multi-currency, user created, decentralized tokens and merge-mineable, interoperable blockchains without programming
 - Enables any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even full fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing 50% POW/50% POS, 51% hash attack resistant blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain which launched it. All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects may choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. In doing so, they will start with a complete, multi-currency, ID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network.
## Consensus integrated DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets
- Any ID owner may define Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.
## Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches
 - Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockcha
